meanings.definition: To embody together with another or others.
meanings.sent1: The team coembodies unity and strength on the field.
meanings.sent2: Their performance coembodies the spirit of collaboration.
meanings.sent3: The twins coembodies the saying 'two heads are better than one'.
meanings.sent4: The painting coembodies the essence of love and harmony.
meanings.sent5: The music coembodies joy and celebration in every note.

meanings.sent1: The symbol coembodies peace and tranquility.
meanings.sent2: Their actions coembodies the values of honesty and integrity.
meanings.sent3: The costume coembodies the idea of creativity and imagination.
meanings.sent4: The story coembodies the struggles and triumphs of the human spirit.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture coembodies beauty and grace in its form.
